channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2023110707
item.description:
Report X-2023110707

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found 11-2 at 0600 in the unload area, carton was wet and was brought to QA for inspection DescribePack: inner container became cracked at lid which caused internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe was used to contain package in a plastic hazmat bag which was then placed in a sealed plastic tote

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.description:
Report X-2023111027

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE M2 BOXLINE FOR A LEAKER. BOX WITH OXIDIXER HAZARDOUS MATERIALS LABEL WAS FOUND WET ON THE SLIDE. USING THE DECISION TREE, OXIDIZER RESPONSE SHEET AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2023110672

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was tipped on side allowing the loose cap to leak inside. Loader noticed the wet package and alerted QA. In house clean up. Placed in salvage drum and sealed. DescribePack: Cap inside was loose inside and started leaking when tipped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fiberboard absorbed the liquid. In house clean up. Placed in salvage drum awaiting disposition from pgh.

item.title: Report X-2023110964
item.description:
Report X-2023110964

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: INSUFFICIENT OUT AND INNER PACKAGING ALLOWING MOVEMENT. THIS ALLOWED TOP OF BOTTLE TO BECOME CRUSHED AND CRACKED ALLOWING LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR. NO DIAMOND ON OUTER CARTON. LTD. QTY. DIAMOND WAS ON INNER BOX AND WAS PLACED ON ITS SIDE. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023110495
item.description:
Report E-2023110495

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: UPPER SANDUSKY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFM experienced a UN3066 Sika Floor 161-264 Part B release from a 1-gallon metal can. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of material released to a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pail was containerized into a double lined 55-gallon metal drum. Soda ash and absorbents were then deployed to neutralize and clean the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and impacted pallet pieces were then containerized into a second double lined 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110332
item.description:
Report E-2023110332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: Brewster
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1100 hrs. on 10-23-2023, the WLE Brewster Yardmaster called myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. He told me the Brewster Yard Car Inspectors could smell an odor from tank car CPDX 111023. I came out to look at the car and used a gas detection meter on the protective house and confirmed that this car was leaking. I removed cable seal #1756092 and opened the protective housing to find that the A end liquid valve was frosted over and leaking. I checked the valve handle to find that it was loose. The valve was leaking through the valve plug threads. I tightened the valve and the leak stopped. It took about an 1/8 of a turn to stop the leak. I then tightened the valve plug. I reinstalled cable seal 0000235 on the protective housing and then released the car for service.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON THE SIDE, WAS PUT INTO TOTE AND BAG DescribePack: THE LIDS LOOSENED AND LEAKED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN BAG INTO TOTE.
